TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , is an NORP national and lives in GPE ) . In the proceedings before the ORG he is represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising PERSON .

On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE . On DATE he applied for asylum . In support of his request he submitted that , as a member of the People 's Mujahedin movement , his father had been arrested and killed . The applicant further submitted that when distributing leaflets together with a friend , his friend had been arrested . Thereafter he himself had been arrested CARDINAL times and detained for DATE . His whole family , i.e. his mother and his CARDINAL sisters , had fled from GPE . They had all been recognised as political refugees in GPE .
On DATE ORG für die ORG ) dismissed the applicant ’s request on the ground that his submissions were not credible and invited him to leave the NORP territory within DATE .
On DATE ORG ( Verwaltungsgericht ) dismissed the action filed by the applicant against the refusal of asylum and his envisaged expulsion .

On DATE the applicant renewed his request to be granted asylum ( PERSON ) . When interviewed on DATE at ORG , the applicant repeated the statements he had made in the first asylum proceedings , adding some more details . He further submitted that in the meantime he had engaged in political activities in GPE in favour of the ORG movement , such as distributing leaflets , organising information stands , taking part in demonstrations and working in the movement ’s office in GPE . The media , in particular television , had published information about these activities which thus came to the knowledge of the NORP authorities . An NORP witness called by the applicant stated , when also heard on DATE before ORG , that he had met the applicant in DATE in front of ORG near a bookshop with a third person called A. The latter had talked to the applicant and handed him a shoe box . According to the witness , he was not informed about the contents of the box for security reasons . The applicant did not remember PERSON ’s first name , nor did the witness .

On DATE ORG dismissed the asylum request on the grounds that the applicant ’s statements did not appear to be credible and that they were in contradiction with the statements made in the first proceedings and that his political activities in GPE were not important enough to establish a real and substantial fear of persecution in GPE .
On DATE the applicant filed an action with ORG .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action . According to the court , there was no indication that the applicant was persecuted when he had left his country , nor was there a sufficient likelihood that he would be persecuted if he were to return to his country . His earlier and his new submissions concerning his arrests in GPE were unsubstantiated . Accordingly , there was no need to take further evidence in this respect . As to the statements of the NORP witness concerning the circumstances of the meeting with the applicant in front of ORG , the court observed that there were contradictions between the applicant ’s and the witness ’s declarations . Furthermore , the witness could not confirm that the applicant was involved in the ORG movement , since he had met him only once . The court added that the applicant ’s activities in GPE did not go beyond a mere presence at demonstrations and other events , and that they would not expose him to political persecution in GPE . Finally there was no reason to believe that the applicant would face persecution in GPE on the ground that he had requested asylum in GPE .

On DATE ORG ( Oberverwaltungsgericht ) of ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal ( PERSON ) . In its decision it stated that ORG had correctly assessed the evidence and rejected the applicant ’s requests to take further evidence in a convincing manner . ORG had not acted arbitrarily in concluding that the applicant ’s submissions were unsubstantiated .

On DATE ORG informed the applicant that following the final decision in his asylum proceedings , his residence permit was no longer valid and invited him to submit CARDINAL passport photographs for the purpose of a provisional residence permit ( PERSON ) to be issued for the period during which the expulsion order could not be implemented for legal or practical reasons .
On DATE the ORG of the of the Land of North - Rhine Westphalia rejected a petition brought by the applicant on the ground that his submissions did not justify the granting of political asylum .
